results.title: Marriage
results.brief_description: An historical look at the instruction of marriage and the changing role of women within marriage leads to an examination of marriage in contemporary society. Sociologist Jessie Bernard provides an insight into marriage relationships, a Catholic priest lectures to engaged Catholic couples, and a marriage counsellor helps a couple to communicate.

results.brief_description: Public relations film on the recreated goldfield township Sovereign Hill, (Ballarat, Victoria), providing an insight into the lifestyles of the day. No other credits available.

results.title: What's wrong with our schools?
results.brief_description: Milton Friedman argues that the growing role of government in financing and administering schooling has led to enormous waste of taxpayers money but also to an inferior education system than would have developed had voluntary co-operation played a larger role.
results.description: Milton Friedman argues that the growing role of government in financing and administering schooling has led to enormous waste of taxpayers money but also to an inferior education system than would have developed had voluntary co-operation played a larger role.

results.title: Created equal
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Milton Friedman discusses freedom and equality, arguing that a society which maximises the scope for individual choice and action will be more successful at creating equal opportunities for all than a society which seeks to achieve quality through distribution of wealth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts

results.title: Anatomy of crisis
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Causes of the Great Depression have been widely debated. One of the most widely accepted explanations is that it resulted from a failure of free market capitalism. Milton Friedman rejects this conclusion. He argues that a failure of government authorities to manage monetary policy, that is, controlling the amount of money in circulation, properly is a much more supportable explanation for the Depression. To acquire a better understanding of the pivotal role monetary forces play and to develop a better grasp of the causes of the Great Deparession, it is helpful to look closely at the role of money and the workings of banking systems. Presented by Milton Friedman. Suitable for middle, upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Power of the market
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Eben Wilson and Rose Friedman
results.brief_description: First in a ten part series in which economist Milton Friedman expounds his views on various aspects of the market economy. In this film Friedman examines economic freedom as it operates in America and Hong Kong, and the individual freedom that results from it.

results.title: Pelicans
results.brief_description: Shows pelicans flying together in flocks, building their nests, hatching heir eggs and caring for heir young. Shows the attempts of the young to fly.

results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: ostriches
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: The ostrich is the tallest and heaviest of all bird species, using its feet and sharp talons to protect itself against other animals. Shows the courting behaviour of the male and female ostrich as well as the care of the young. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Monkeys
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Shows different species of monkeys and their characteristics, noting that while most monkeys live in hot climates, there are some that prefer snow. Also shows the lemur, a tree-dwelling primate which although similar to the monkey is not of the same species. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
